title: Generate Orbits for Spanning Trees
text: Consider tetrahedron, self-dual polyhedron 4 vertices, 4 faces, 6 edges. (See: https://dmccooey.com/polyhedra/Tetrahedron.html) use external tools assemble data concerning polyhedron. Sage GAP, accessed using Sage Cells. run code shown Sage Cell, click Evaluate button cell. spanning tree (skeleton graph ) tetrahedron 3 edges, connect 4 vertices, without cycles. two different trees 4 vertices. evaluations see 16 different spanning trees tetrahedron, 16 2 orbits. (document, Table 1, suggests exactly 2 orbits.) spanning tree tetrahedron 3 edges, tetrahedron self dual, look data pertinent two sets 3 edges. use GAP . evaluate GAP code, see symmetric group S6S6 2 subgroups order 36, called S3XS3S3 X S3. , looking representatives right cosets S6S6 either subgroups, appears interesting relation 2 sets 3 edges mentioned . use R code package explore relation.
